ca.uqac.lif.cep.tmf

Class StateSlicer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.cep.Processor
      • ca.uqac.lif.cep.SingleProcessor
        • ca.uqac.lif.cep.tmf.StateSlicer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Contextualizable, Cloneable

    public class StateSlicer
extends SingleProcessor
    Separates an input trace into different "slices". The slicer takes as input a processor p and a slicing function f. There exists potentially one instance of p for each value in the image of f.

    When an event e arrives, the slicer evaluates c = f(e). This value determines to what instance of p the event will be dispatched. If no slice with such value currently exists, a new instance of p will be created. The processor then outputs a Collection object (typically a set) containing the last events returned by every slice.

    The function f may return null, or the special object StateSlicer.ToAllSlices. This indicates that no new slice must be created, but that the incoming event must be dispatched to all slices one by one.

    Author:
    Sylvain Hall√©

      • addContextFromSlice

        public void addContextFromSlice(Processor p,
                       Object slice)
        Adds elements to the context of a newly created slice. By default, nothing is done. Descendants of this class may want to add context elements to the processor, based on the value of the newly created slice.
        Parameters:
        p - The newly created processor
        slice - The value associated to the slice

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: Processor
        Resets the processor. This has for effect of flushing the contents of all input and output event queues. If the processor has an internal state, this should also reset this state to its "initial" settings (whatever that means in your context).
